Reviews.Title: “Not the best....by far”
Reviews.Author: mbhersh99
Reviews.Content: If you like ridiculously tiny rooms for a ridiculous amount of money, snooty (more than usual) front desk staff, unhelpful restaurant recommendations and turn-down service at inconvenient times, then this hotel is for you!!!. The great location was marred by sub-everything. we definitely wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “luxury without glitz”
Reviews.Author: raenette
Reviews.Content: low key..excellent service the staff is SO Helpful and go the extra mile..open bar is a plus and you can invite your friends..rooms have everything you need including paper clips & stapler...located in the center of the left bank...a treasure

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in the St. Germain area.”
Reviews.Author: Seisman
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice (some a bit small) and very comfortable. The hotel is well located, and there are many sights, and fine restaurants within walking distance. The staff is extremely helpful and always ready go beyond the call of duty. The rates include breakfast and an open bar (24/7) with lots of nice offerings. This was our third stay and is our favorite hotel in Paris. To write more would need lots of words describing greatness.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Jeis0n
Reviews.Content: The kind staff, the quiet atmosphere and the superb bedroom made me proud of my choice of Esprit Saint-Germain. I thought it was expensive until I got there. It worths the expense. Hope I can afford to stay there again the next time we travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This will be our Paris hotel from now on!”
Reviews.Author: briangood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for six nights in October on the advice of our travel agent (TTI) and I'm so happy we took her advice. This is a wonderful little boutique hotel on the Left Bank, steps from the Luxembourg, the Seine, Les Deux Magots and many fine restaurants and shops. The staff are wonderful - Caroline, the assistant manager greeted us warmly on our return from a few days in Provence. She has a gift for making one feel special. The front desk staff are very helpful, arranging taxis, answering all our questions, even helping me get wi-fi access to my new Ipad, which I'm just getting used to. The location is perfect for sightseeing, most attractions being either walking distance or a short taxi ride. The rooms are adequate but don't look for huge - this is Paris after all. But they are clean and comfortable. The shower had the best water pressure I've ever seen in a hotel. What was really nice was that after a day of galleries, shops and sightseeing we could retire to the lounge for a scotch (Glenfiddich) or glass of champagne - no charge. Our package included a driver to and from the airport as well as a very nice cheese tray. It's nice to see your driver waiting for you as you step out of arrivals, holding up a card with your name on it. Pampering like this I could get used to! Also included was a very good breakfast every morning, choice of eggs any style, etc. If you're looking for some pampering and at the same time good value, look no farther.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dallascouple50
Reviews.Content: We love the location in St. Germain. We stayed in room 501 (the suite) and had to move mid week to 502 (next door with a terrace but a regular room). The suite was nice and it should be at 810 euros a night, but 502 had a terrace that when we opened the doors all we heard was the buzz of the scooters that sounded like a bunch of bees. We found oursleves never using the terrece. The A/C wasn't working up to standards, the internet was not working in the room, but the service was at a standard that we have encountered at the Ritz. Overall it is a great hotal with a few issues in a great location and a staff that will go out of there way to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Good, recommended with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60604
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well locted, within a couple blocks of noisier busier Left Bank tourist areas. Walking distance of all major sites, Louvre, Notre Dam, Luxemboug Gardens and many other wonderful Left Bank more Parisian venues and streets. Other areas are longer walking but the Metro is only a couple blocks away (actually several lines and stations are near) the area is surrounded by excellent shops of all sorts, cafes, restaurants and markets and the Hotel will recommend good ones. Superior room was ok but would have been too small for two people with clothes and shoes for a long trip with various dress occasions. There were no drawers and the closet storage was quite small. Bedside storage should have and could easily have been better, there simply was no room on the bedside table, the desk was very small and no drawers to speak of. The bathroom size was small but acceptable with decent counterspace and cabinet storage. And with a coffee maker and a mini bar that was restocked ( and free) with a little space for wine or cheese, etc. The amenities of the hotel make this a good value, good location, free wifi, and lobby lounges with free drinks at all times. The rooms are comfortable to sit and read in and the champagne and other drinks are indeed kept supplied. Several pieces of fruit are placed in the bedroom everyday. Breakfast was excellent and mine was included, as was pickup and return to train and airport. The service was mediocre in my opinion. Many of the front desk personnel were inattentive, untrained, too busy. Any thing that was not a very common tourist request was unknown, too difficult or simply impossible. Most of the time I simply ended up doing it myself (a St Martin Canal trip, a restaurant that could accommodate a vegetarian, etc, not too odd ball at all) although the rooms were generally clean, several times things were just forgotten or not done, including leaving large pieces of glass from a glass broken by housekeeping on my bathroom floor. All in all, good value and location and amenities. More training would make it better

Reviews.Title: “I hesitate to tell”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveller08
Reviews.Content: Finding an expensive hotel in Paris is easy , finding a good boutique hotel with an open bar is almost impossible. This place has good rooms ( paris size) great staff and a wonderful location on a quiet street(not easy in Paris) ,as to staff my daughter tried to open a champagne bottle and it exploded on the floor ( it leaves a nice sheen ) staff didnt blink an eye , cleaned up , brought another bottle all with a smile

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Paris”
Reviews.Author: goodogg
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Esprit Saint Germain as our base for what could be our one and only trip to Paris and we are so happy that we did. The location was absolutely perfect and the lovely hotel and it's amenities made our stay in Paris perfect. We choose the junior suite with terrace on the 5th floor and although the room is small, it is so perfectly planned and has such excellent storage that once we unpacked, it did not seem cramped at all. If I was to go there again, I would probably choose either a standard room or the larger suite on the first floor that does not have a terrace. I say that because there is so much road noise (lots of scooters and motorcycles) in Paris, that leaving the window to the terrace open at night was out of the question. We did enjoy a lovely lunch out there though, with lovely finger food purchased at the fresh market that is just around the corner from the hotel. We indulged in the champagne in the afternoon and before bed - the open bar is a very nice touch at this hotel, whether you want champagne of just water or a soda - it makes it seem that you have a large family home in Paris! Breakfast was absolutely heavenly, I indulged in omlettes and croissants daily with no guilt! I loved the hotel staff, they were so helpful with providing us with directions, recommendations and just general chit-chat, I actually missed them when we checked out to continue our adventured through France. I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else if we do find ourselves returning to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ollie1952
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this hotel in Paris. Its a small boutique hotel with a nice atmosphere, friendly staff who speak pretty good english and modern, reasonably sized bedrooms and modern, up to the minute, bathrooms. The possible downside for some people (but not us) is that there is no restaurant and only two relatively small function rooms or lounges - but there is a help yourself bar during the day. Good continental breakfast (eggs etc on request) in one of the rooms. But not having a restaurant really isnt a problem because the area (Saint Germain) is awash with good restaurants and bistros and many are literally a stones throw away. Apart from restaurants the area is excellent - lots of smaller more interesting shops and markets nearby and only a taxi ride away from all the sights and museums. (we have found Taxi drivers in Paris helpful and reasobaly priced and able to get from A to B so much quicker than in London!) Never seen children there, very much a couples/business type atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: katstrov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Esprit quite by accident when our already booked and paid in full accommodation elsewhere "fell through" (note: do not book an apartment via "A La Carte" - very dodgy!!) The Hotel Esprit saved the day (being NYE, if was not easy to find anything) and now we will always stay there when we visit Paris. The location, firstly, is perfect, nestled in St Germain. The staff are all so warm and welcoming - no question is too silly, no request too difficult. I really cannot praise them enough. The breakfast is delicious. The rooms are not large, but this is normal for Paris. One of the best things about this hotel is its two lounge areas - all drinks - alcoholic and non alcoholic are "on the house". I cannot tell you how lovely it is to help yourself to a tea after a day of sightseeing, listening to cool French grooves and snuggled into a cosy couch in front of the fire; or to pop in for a pre dinner champagne, or a post dinner champagne. A scoop of jelly beans for the kids (or adults!). It really makes the trip very comfortable and homely. We stayed for 8 nights and we were all sad to leave........ my only fault with the hotel would be the bathrooms - they are tiny and there is no shower screen or curtain, so a terribly mess from each shower, particularly if washing hair. But apart from that, Tres Bon

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, fit for a king and queen”
Reviews.Author: allanwexler27
Reviews.Content: This little gem on the left bank is a great hotel. Small (only 28 rooms) but cozy, it comes with an "all in" package which means that all drinks, hard or soft, are complimentary. It allows the feeling of being at home since people generally stop for a drink at the end of the evening or a day of shopping. Breakfasts are fabulous and the dining area is like ones own living room. Staff are very friendly. The rooms are small, but efficient and the location is excellent, allowing us to walk to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Eifel tower, Rodin museum etc. Close to St. Germain which is good for shopping and dining and within a couple blocks of the metro. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Stay Here: It's a no-brainer for location and charm”
Reviews.Author: NYCWGV
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, we found the Esprit Saint Germain mid-stay in Paris and it changed our vacation. We had stumbled across it on Rue St. Sulpice and upon entering to inquiry about prices and rooms the staff immediately welcomed us. The lobby is warm with an open bar and coffee (accessible for free to all guests 24 hours). Our room classification was the cheapest, but was outfitted perfectly and comfortable. In spite of its small size, it worked well for two adults over four nights. The lighting controls and reading levels were great, the mini-bar (with a modest selection of beverages) was nice, and the bathroom shower (and separate commode) were amble in size with Etro products. The breakfast, which was included in the room rate, was wonderful as well. I have nothing bad to say at all. The best part was walking out of the hotel onto Rue St. Sulpice and always being welcomed back with a friendly smile. If you're a traveler that likes to be in the heart of things then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: a_Brit_3119
Reviews.Content: We loved it. The Esprit Saint Germain is fantastic. The rooms are great, decent size with good bathrooms. (Previously we stayed in the Hotel Costes and the rooms are very small) The service was fantastaic. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, who were every one of them very friendly. We would love to return again. Saint Germain is a gorgeous area of Paris with lots of lovely cafes and bars.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Peace-L4
Reviews.Content: Small hotel. Ideal location. Yummy breakfast and drinks. Cozy and spacious lobby—a perfect respite after our wintery walks in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentGal100
Reviews.Content: We staying in early August (I know it has taken me a while to write this review ) and absoultely loved the hotel. I have been to Paris before but this was a first for my husband & four year old daughter. We were thrilled with the hotel and staff. The room was very comfortable and we thought spacious. Other reviews had said the rooms were small but I could not disagree more. With several suitcases and three bodies we had no trouble at all. I had a tour of the hotel and all the rooms are equally as nice. We really enjoyed the lobby open bar and the staff were extremely accomodating. One evening after we got "home" and relaxed in the lobby having a drink. My daughter mentioned she wanted a hot chocolate. We explained that they did not have any and it was late but obviously we were overheard and within minutes had one specially made for her. I had also booked our car rental for the end of our Paris stay to pick up back at the airport. I just mentioned in passing that I wish that I had made it for something close to the hotel and the hotel manager had it arranged for me. Just like that. All the staff are friendly and gracious and as a Travel Agent I would highly recommend this hotel to my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Parisian "W"”
Reviews.Author: Anomina
Reviews.Content: Lucked into this hotel after our original choice was under renovation. As others have noted, the rooms are small but that didn't bother us and the attentive staff and other details more than made up for it. Our stay was all inclusive so that the champagne, wine, and snacks in the lobby as well as made-to-order breakfast in the room was included in the reasonable rate (for Paris at least!). The hotel is modern but still charming and the location is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2travelbugsMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed it very much. The room was nicely appointed but very small. The closet was tiny and there was no other storage for clothes or luggage. The bathroom was also small, but there was a separate water closet. Location was very good and the staff was very helpful. Breakfast was great and there was coffee and tea in the room. The lobby areas were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in hushed tones”
Reviews.Author: Traveleroftaste
Reviews.Content: Esprit is all about the Left Bank! A great location set in the most fashionable district of Paris, surrounded by the loveliest boutiques and shops, all types of galleries and patisseries like Pierre Herme and Gérard Mulot. It is truly in walking distance to the heart of Paris... the Louvre, Musee D’Orsay and Notre Dame. The hotel, as you know, is within sight of the Church of Saint Sulpice, but also it is sandwiched between both Rue Bonaparte and Rue de Seine -- which take you directly to the river... via a wonderful array of restaurants, galleries and cafes like Deux Magots, Cafe de Fleur and don’t miss - Laduree. The blocks around the hotel simply breathe of luxury in hushed tones. The creativity that goes into Parisian window displays – whether to front a high-fashion house or a neighborhood chocolatier – is unmatched anywhere in the world. This is one of the best neighborhoods to experience window shopping, where a medieval maze of streets have trend-setting boutiques, old shops like Poilane, as well as, larger stores like Au Bon Marché. Between the church of St-Germain-des-Prés and that of St-Sulpice, hides a little restaurant La Petite Cour and just a little further is great dining at Helene Darroze. All of this adds to your stay at Esprit Saint Germain. The hotel interior has the same panache - subtle but its detail, detail, detail. The cozy fireplace in the living room just lures you in like being in a private club. Wonderful candles add to the glow and fresh aromas. Everything has been thought out. As the hotel is small - efficiency rules and the space is utilized very smartly. The bathrooms are perfectly fitted, sleek slate, great lighting, mirrors with storage behind, and a deep soaking tub. Mini-bars are very generous. Tea/coffee maker well supplied. Liked a bottle of water on the desk. And loved being sent off to the airport with a bottle of water for the trip... a very thoughtful gesture -- and there were plenty of them. The breakfast room is warm with the lovely vaulted ceiling - well lit with modern fixtures ample for reading the morning paper and quiet. I found this an ideal spot for breakfast. Excellent quality of jams, honey and butter. The staff was exceptional -- polite, friendly and were proactive hosts. They take exceptional pride in the hotel. This is a jewel and it creates the magic! If every guest has my experience the client satisfaction and loyalty and word of mouth will undoubtedly will have the hotel will be full year round and I won't be able to get reservations. I am be confident every guest is going to have a special experience on the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Rane
Reviews.Content: I have styed at many of the large, famous 5* hotels in Paris. This time I wanted to have something different and chose Esprit Saint Germain. This hotel is very pleasant, elegant and low-profile luxurious. No gold glittering, no fancy tricks. Small, boutique style. Very frienly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, miserable hotel”
Reviews.Author: cecileNoumea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Esprit Saint Germain in February 2007. Eventhough the hotel was quiet empty at that time, I really didn't like this place. The rates are above all very expensive for what it is (small rooms, amenities unknown) The hotel is to modern and to dark. The staff has no organisation, the concierge are not real clefs d'or and give wrong directions, or bad restaurants advises. They are never updated with their propositions. Buying a michelin guide is even better. I really hated that place, and would never consider to return again. Of course, the area is however great. But you should consider going to other design hotels in the area. What a despite!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: paris407
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay with my daughter. It was perfect. Perfect location, perfect rooms ( albeit small!!), wonderful amenities. As posted before the extra touches were quite special and made the stay very comfortable. A few minor comments... there is construction in progress on both sides of the building so there is some noise and hammering during the day - when you will be out and about hopefully. The staff while gracious and thoughtful for the most part, sent us off in the wrong direction on two separate occasions - it was easily remedied by the staff in the metro. Finally, we did ask for a recommendation for a local French bistro one evening and were sent to an average tourist place ( Le Christine). Despite these minor inconveniences - I will return on my next trip. Overall it was manifique!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: drinkingfashionista
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business twice now and it is my favorite. Lobby has fireplace where you sit with a glass of wine while they check you in. Free mini-bar in the room. Sleep under the stars in your room! Fabulous staff-

Reviews.Title: “Completely Mediocre in a beautiful part of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: FrancOphilenyc
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a small boutique hotel in the 6 or 7 arr and booked Esprit Saint Germain on the recommendations of some travel magazines and Tripadvisor. Paris hotel rooms can be small, but we had a Superior room that was so small we had to laugh. Between the bed and our two (carry-on size) suitcases, there was no (zero!) room to move. The shower backed up every morning (until we complained), the dvd/cd player (in the tv, with horrible speakers) had a mind of its own, the blowdryer had a cord so short it was useless, and the touted free/open minibar in the room consisted of two bottles of budweiser, water, juice and a couple packaged cookies. The Superior room is supposed to come with fruit and flowers, and it did -- one plum, six grapes and one rose bud in a vase, (which to us seems not really worth even mentioning). The hotel sounds luxurious on its website but in reality it was subpar and the room mediocre. That said, the staff is incredibly thoughtful, attentive, and great. Room service came exactly when they were supposed to. The lounge, with a better stocked open wetbar, is lovely and always had a fire going. The hotel is also very clean and quiet, and most importantly the location cannot beat. But we've stayed in other hotels in the neighborhood for approximately the same rate as Esprit Saint Germain -- considering the high rates and in light of the rave reviews, we were expecting much much much more.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: marnman
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and I chose the Esprit St. Germain based on the reviews I'd read at Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed! The entire experience was excellent. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room, while small, which from what I'd read and heard is typical of Paris, was well appointed with a larger than expected bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The amenities are first rate and the decor is sleek and modern which was a nice contrast to much of Paris. In fact, I can't think of one negative thing to say about the hotel. We enjoyed the "living room" lounge both before and after dinner for a cocktail or nibble. It was a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris. The location is excellent with three Metro stops within a few blocks and lots of excellent restaurants within easy walking distance (try Le Meditaranee or Le Reminet--both superb). And, the highlight for me was the excellent patisserie around the corner (Gerard Mulot) --tres bien!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TripReviewerNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and were extremely happy with it and will definitely return. The property is warm, modern and ideally located in Saint Germain, and the staff went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable and easy as possible, including by making reservations (and providing mapped directions to the reserved locations!) and arranging transportation. All of the staff were very nice and genuinely happy to help. The room was great and the bathroom was excellent in comparison to comparable hotels. Extra touches such as the fact that every day fresh fruit was left in the room and the open bar in the room and downstairs reflect the hotel's thoughful attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TheVastMachine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant from start to finish. Check in was fast and friendly. The guy who checked us accompanied us to the room and explained all of its features. The room itself was small but incredibly well appointed. Lots of storage space for a room of its size. Clean, modern lines, and everything in the room worked perfectly. Internet is wireless and free, albeit kind of slow. (The only issue was for some strange reason I could not access gmail or american express from my laptop, though I could from the hotel's PC in the basement.) The free bar in the comfortable lobby certainly doesn't hurt! The area is chock full of good restaurants. Except for the slow internet and the lack of soda water in the bar (!) this hotel is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mwellsVenice_CA
Reviews.Content: The Esprit Saint Germain is set in the most fashionable district of Paris so it puts you in the heart of everything. There is no "check-in" desk at this hotel, only lounges where upon your arrival you are served with complimentary beverages and a snack as you check in. We booked a standard room (the lowest priced of all their rooms) but there was nothing standard about it. The room was spacious and light-filled with a huge King sized bed (beautifully made up with down comforter and incredibly soft sheets), a desk and small lounge chair. It had a nice bathroom with a deep soaking tub and all the modern conveniences found in great boutique hotels. The staff was so friendly, well informed and always provided maps whenever we asked for directions to areas of interest. The continental breakfast was adequate but good (French food tends to be good in general) though there are numerous cafes where you could venture to eat. This hotel is excellent for visitors who have already been to Paris and want to "live it up"! Can't beat the location, the energy of the neighborhood and its proximity to all things you would want to discover and know about Paris. Highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “pili very good front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and very friendly staff specialy Pili, We will come soon. We found our home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paris can be overwhelming and, like any big city, unwelcoming. How nice, then, to have a place to call home! Esprit Saint Germain, with its warm and knowledgeable staff, its cozy lounge with open drinks bar and pin neat, deliciously comfortable rooms -- albeit small -- is that place. Perfectly located in the heart of Saint Germain, with room prices well located on today's outrageous rate scale, this is a real gem that makes what could be a forbidding city a place to call home.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, the Right Hotel on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Charming, Friendly, Chic and minimalist without being silly - this is a jewel. If you are tired of the big super Luxe hotels (and many of us are) this is a nice alternative where you don't feel fussed over - but you do feel cared for and well-attended. I am a frequent traveller to Paris, and most of my experience has been with the Ritz, Plaza Athenee, and Le Bristol. They are all fine properties. But my attempts at finding the right, small left bank hotel have all been disappointments - until Esprit Saint Germain. Very intimate without being too familiar, chic enough to make you feel comfortable if you are used to living well, and well-located in the 6th, steps from everything. With all the services you have come to expect, but none of the pretension - and a few extra special warm touches to make you want to come back sooner rather than later. Staff - professional, warm and charming people; Rooms, small, but well-done and cleverly laid out to smartly use the space; CLEAN; QUIET; This does not feel like a hotel as much as a small, quiet, private club. This is the jewel of the Rive Gauche and until I find the perfect Paris apartment, I see no reason to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Why Go Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This trendy and superbly located boutique hotel is something special. The staff were incredible. From offering coffee (or champagne) as you check-in, through all the way to not only brining an ironing board to the room, but offering to do the ironing! An absolute Gem, I shouldn't tell anyone, as I'll no doubt struggle to get in if everyone finds out. Give yourself a treat and enjoy! Great rooms, great staff and superb location - Why go anywhere else??

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Esprit Saint Germain
